item.title: Indexing in Python
item.description: Indexing is when you grab certain elements from a vector or list. It’s done a little differently in Python compared to R. First, let’s take a look at how indexing is done in R. I’ve made a list of my favorite fruits. I did this in reticulate so that I can access the same list in Python. Now, I’ll grab the second through fourth elements in the list in R: library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.
